snippet: Developing swimming nations overwhelmingly embrace the current format of preliminaries followed by a 16-athlete semifinal and culminating in an eight-swimmer final.
abstract: American swimmer Rebecca Soni, the defending Olympic champion, breaks the world record in the 200-meter breaststroke semifinal in 2 minutes 20.00 seconds; developing swimming nations embrace the current Olympic format of preliminaries followed by semifinals and a final; countries focused on medal count, like the United States, would like to see a return to the pre-2000 format of preliminaries and finals so the stars have a less arduous path to gold.
lead_paragraph: Developing swimming nations overwhelmingly embrace the current format of preliminaries followed by a 16-athlete semifinal and culminating in an eight-swimmer final.

headline.seo: Swimming Semifinals Offer Rising Stars Chance at Glory
headline.main: Swimming Semifinals Offer Rising Stars an Extra Chance at Glory
headline.print_headline: Semifinals Offer Rising Stars an Extra Chance at Glory
